pageContext.claim: “The United States is considering, in addition to other options, stopping all trade with any country doing business with North Korea.”
pageContext.analysis: This is clearly an idle threat, given that China by far is North Korea's trading partner. In 2016, the United States sold $116 billion in goods to China and purchased $462 billion, so a sudden cut-off of "all trade" would be devastating to the U.S. economy.
